definition: to startle/to be frightened/to be scared/alarm

sentences.english: From his parents’ face express we can read surprise and anger.
sentences.chinese: 從他父母的表情中我們讀出了驚愕和憤怒。

sentences.english: Six-character numeric passwords are dismayingly common, and the examples only go downhill from there.
sentences.chinese: 六位數字密碼是令人驚愕地相同，並且該例只會變壞。

sentences.english: We were completely amazed at the wonder and the greatness of nature.
sentences.chinese: 這一奇觀和大自然的偉大使我們完全驚愕了。

sentences.english: But, to his dismay, the donkey walks away.
sentences.chinese: 但是，使他驚愕的是，那頭驢走開了。

sentences.english: She was dumbly dismayed at the news.
sentences.chinese: 聽見那消息她驚愕得發呆了。

sentences.english: Edgar sprang to his unbidden guest, blanched with astonishment and rage.
sentences.chinese: 埃德加衝向這位不速之客，臉色因驚愕與憤怒而發白。

sentences.english: She was struck by the incongruity of the situation.
sentences.chinese: 這一局面煞是怪異，讓她驚愕不已。

sentences.english: We were thunderstruck by the death of the President.
sentences.chinese: 總統之死使我們爲之驚愕。

sentences.english: He blinked at the weight of the players.
sentences.chinese: 他驚愕地看那些運動員的體重。

sentences.english: “That really startled me, ” he said of his friend’s death.
sentences.chinese: “這件事讓我十分驚愕，“他說起了他朋友的逝世。”
這沒什麼好驚愕的，我仍舊62歲了。

sentences.english: They sometimes shut down completely, falling into a stupor.
sentences.chinese: 他們有時完全停機了，陷入了驚愕的狀態。

sentences.english: I sat down on the bed, dumbfounded, and stared at the TV.
sentences.chinese: 我坐到牀上，驚愕地盯着電視。

sentences.english: When the bears return home they find her asleep – she awakens and escapes out the window in terror.
sentences.chinese: 當小熊們回家時，她醒過來，驚愕的從窗戶逃走了。

sentences.english: Dear Mr Gao, you amazed me with your idiocy once again.
sentences.chinese: 親愛的高寒先生，你的愚蠢又再次讓我驚愕。

sentences.english: I am appalled at his mistakes.
sentences.chinese: 我對他的錯誤感到驚愕。

definition: to be surprised/to be amazed/to be stunned
to be startled/to be shocked/to be amazed
to be shocked/to be appalled/to be terrified
to cry out in alarm or surprise
overwhelmed with shock, horror or amazement/dumbstruck/aghast
